edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.schedule.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines behavior and state for the Student's schedule by managing the addition and removal of courses. Initializes the title to "My Schedule" and allows the user to reset both title and schedule as necessary.
    Author:
    Arthur Vargas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule()
      Constructs an empty Arraylist of Courses to hold all courses in the Student's schedule.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedule

        public Schedule()
        Constructs an empty Arraylist of Courses to hold all courses in the Student's schedule. Also initializes the title to "My schedule."

    • Method Detail

      • addCourseToSchedule

        public boolean addCourseToSchedule(Course course)
                            throws ConflictException
        Adds a Course to the end of the schedule and confirm addition by returning true if the Course was added, false otherwise. If the Course is a duplicate then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If there is a conflict with an existing Course in the schedule, a ConflictException is thrown with the following message: "The Course cannot be added due to conflict."
        Parameters:
        course - the Course to be added to the schedule
        Returns:
        boolean true if the Course could be added to the schedule, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ConflictException - if there is another Course scheduled at this time

      • removeCourseFromSchedule

        public boolean removeCourseFromSchedule(Course course)
        Removes the parameter specified Course from the schedule. Returns true if the Course was successfully removed, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        course - the Course to be removed from the schedule
        Returns:
        boolean true if this Course was successfully removed, false otherwise

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        Resets the schedule by creating a new ArrayList

      • getScheduledCourses

        public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledCourses()
        Returns a 2D array of Course information. Each row should be a Course and the columns are name, section, title, and the meeting string.
        Returns:
        scheduleArray the 2D array of Course information as

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title parameter value. If the title is null, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the message "Title cannot be null."
        Parameters:
        title - the String representation of the title
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the title is null or blank

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the schedule as a String
        Returns:
        title the title of this schedule

      • getScheduleCredits

        public int getScheduleCredits()
        Gets the total number of credits for all courses on the schedule and returns it.
        Returns:
        scheduledCredits The total number of credits that a student is registered for.

      • canAdd

        public boolean canAdd(Course c)
        checks to see if a course can be added to the schedule. A course can be added to the schedule if it is not null, if it is not duplicate, and if it is not conflicting with something else on the schedule.
        Parameters:
        c - The course to check if it is possible to add to the schedule.
        Returns:
        true if the course can be added and false otherwise.
